result.execSummary:
The defendant John D. Rueth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, John D. Rueth, in custody, appeared with Attorney Anne Terrien.    Defendant asking for a furlough to go to his father's funeral - Saturday, 11/5/2016 11:45 a.m. until 3:45 pm.  Granted.    The defendant shall submit to urine/PBT testing as when returns by jail staff and make a deposit of $100.00 before getting released.
for furlough for father's funeral

Atty Prior

ADDRESS INFO for John D. Rueth
Current: W6679 Timberlane Rd, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States  (Effective: 01-08-2016)
Prior: W6675 Timber Lane Rd., Neillsville, WI 54456

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, John D. Rueth, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.  Victim present.  Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1,2 & 4.  Count 3 is dismissed and read in.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1,2 &4.  Probation 2 years, County Jail 45 days on Count 2 with Huber privileges to start no later than February 7, 2016 by 6:30 pm.  Court Costs.  DNA sample to be provided within 48 hours or as directed by the Clark County Sheriff's Department.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.    Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
Status conference at 01-08-2016 09:10 am
Waived reading of Information  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY
Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, John D. Rueth, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:10 am.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, John D. Rueth, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing. Victim present, requests no contact be dropped. Court grants request and modifies bond to read no violent or otherwise disorderly contact with the victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:40 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-03-2015 11:00 am.
Status conference at 11-25-2015 10:40 am.
Bail/bond hearing at 10-15-2015 11:30 am
Initial appearance at 10-15-2015 11:30 am
from Victim witness Coordinator to defendant informing that the victim is requesting no contact be dropped with copy of letter from victim
Initial appearance at 10-01-2015 03:20 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant is not to possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Additionally, defendant may possess prescription drugs only when prescribed by a medical professional for the defendant, which shall be taken as prescribed.  The defendant shall have no contact with H.O.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
AMENDED 10-15-2015 NO CONTACT WITH H.O. IS RECINDED- INSTEAD DEFENDANT IS NOT TO HAVE ANY VIOLENT OR OTHERWISE DISORDERLY CONTACT WITH H.O.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney
